title: Madeleine West reveals why she won't be getting back together with ex-partner Shannon Bennett
text:
Madeleine West has admitted she is unlikely to get back together with her ex-partner Shannon Bennett after the couple split in September last year.

Speaking on Tuesday's Kyle And Jackie O show, the 39-year-old actress, who has six kids with the celebrity chef, said she doesn't think it is right for couples to stay together just for the sake of the children.

'So there's no chance you want to get back with the [partner]?' radio host Kyle Sandilands asked, as Jackie 'O' Henderson told him to stop badgering their guest on the private matter.

'The whole notion of being bound for life is not necessarily realistic': Madeleine West reveals why she won't be getting back together with ex-partner Shannon Bennett (Pictured: 2016)

However, Madeleine was happy to give the pair a response, responding: 'No. You know what? I'm a big believer that everything in life has a season... We change. We evolve.'

'At some point we go "well I have certain needs I want to have met and you've got certain needs and if the two don't combine and cross in the middle, why fight it and be miserable?" I don't think that's fair to the children either to see two parents that are constantly across purposes.'

The estranged couple, who began dating in 2004 but never married, share six children: Phoenix, Hendrix, Xascha, Xanthe, Xahlia and Margaux.

In February, they relocated with their children to New South Wales coastal town, Byron Bay, after selling their Toorak mansion in Melbourne for $16 million.

Elsewhere, Kyle asked Madeleine if she had a 'love interest' or was having 'sex with a surfer dude', but the blonde beauty said: 'I am chaced at the moment, I am like a monk.'

Kyle exclaimed she would be very sought after around the Byron Bay hinterland, but Madeleine sarcastically quipped: 'With six children? Yeah! I've got them lining up.'

'I'm a big believer that everything in life has a season... We change. We evolve': Madeleine said she was unlikely to get back with Shannon as they had different needs that didn't match up

Family life: The estranged couple, who began dating in 2004 but never married, share six children: Phoenix, Hendrix, Xascha, Xanthe, Xahlia and Margaux

'it puts exponential pressures on a relationship, and cracks can form': Madeleine told Stellar magazine last year that she and Shannon were 'striving to reconnect as friends and parents', adding that having six children had put a strain on their relationship

Last year Madeleine told Stellar magazine that she and Shannon were 'striving to reconnect as friends and parents', adding that having six children had put a strain on their relationship.

'Having a public profile, having two high-pressure careers, having a multitude of children – and I will say they are a lot harder to train than dragons – it puts exponential pressures on a relationship, and cracks can form, and things that we don't necessarily plan in the beginning can happen,' she explained.

Meanwhile, the former Neighbours star will reprises her role as Kath Rickards in the second season of AFL-themed drama Playing For Keeps on Channel 10, which debuts on Wednesday, September 16.
description: Madeleine West has admitted she is unlikely to get back together with her ex-partner Shannon Bennett after the couple split in September last year.
authors: Candice Jackson For Daily Mail Australia
